intro: Scalesia microcephala var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed magnolia, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. This species is notable for its ecological importance in the unique ecosystems of the Galápagos.
